Highways England is looking to set up a contract to provide the Operational Technology Engineering and Architecture Services Group with specialist technical support. This is needed to identify and document the data exchanges and processes that will be needed for the business to deploy and commission commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) type products at the roadside, generally, and for CCTV specifically, those that are necessary for Highways England's adoption of industry standard Open Network Video Interface Forum (ONVIF) based equipment.

Highways England is looking to complete the half joint assessment of M55 Broughton Circle and M6 Castle How Bridge, started in 2019/20. The final agreed capacity between assessor, checker and Highways England will determine what, if any future restrictions or works are required to keep the M55 and M6 safe and operational in that location.
